name: Bore Worm
immune: fire, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

trait.name: Tunneler
text: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Regeneration
text: The worm regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
text: The worm makes two attacks: one with its grinding jaws and one with its stinger.

action.name: Grinding Jaws
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Stinger
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 19 (3d6 + 9) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

description:
Trobriand modeled this 100-foot-long, 15-foot-diameter drilling machine after a purple worm. Unless Trobriand commands it to do otherwise, the worm tirelessly moves through well-worn tunnels and trenches. It mindlessly attacks anything that gets in its way, and occasionally ventures up to level 12 or down to level 14. Characters hear it long before they see it.
Source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage p. 171
